text:
It’s the end of the apocalypse as we know it: Fox has cancelled Will Forte’s doomsday satire Last Man on Earth after four seasons, TVLine has confirmed. The axing means that last Sunday’s finale — which ended on a cliffhanger — will now serve as a series finale.

Last Man on Earth this season averaged a 0.8 demo rating and just under 2 million total weekly viewers (in Live+Same Day numbers), down a tick from Season 3 and ranking sixth in the demo out of Fox’s nine comedies.

Co-star January Jones announced the series’ demise on Instagram.

Series creator and star Will Forte later broke his silence on Twitter:

Sad news yesterday. As many have already heard, the show is not being brought back for a fifth season. On behalf of our little family, thank you for all of your support. It was an experience that I’ll cherish forever ❤️ pic.twitter.com/TsJDLG370u — Will Forte (@OrvilleIV) May 11, 2018
title: Last Man on Earth Cancelled at Fox
